trans-unit.source: Prepare to authenticate Resource Manager requests
trans-unit.target: Prepare to authenticate Resource Manager requests

trans-unit.source: You must authenticate all the operations that you perform on resources using the [Azure Resource Manager][lnk-authenticate-arm] with Azure Active Directory (AD).
trans-unit.target: You must authenticate all the operations that you perform on resources using the [Azure Resource Manager][lnk-authenticate-arm] with Azure Active Directory (AD).

trans-unit.source: The easiest way to configure this is to use PowerShell or Azure CLI.
trans-unit.target: The easiest way to configure this is to use PowerShell or Azure CLI.

trans-unit.source: If you have not installed [Azure PowerShell 1.0][lnk-powershell-install], you can do so with the following PowerShell commands.
trans-unit.target: If you have not installed [Azure PowerShell 1.0][lnk-powershell-install], you can do so with the following PowerShell commands.

trans-unit.source: You will need to run PowerShell as an administrator.
trans-unit.target: You will need to run PowerShell as an administrator.

trans-unit.source: The following steps show how to set up password authentication for an AD application using PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: The following steps show how to set up password authentication for an AD application using PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: You can run these commands in a standard PowerShell session.
trans-unit.target: You can run these commands in a standard PowerShell session.

trans-unit.source: Log in to your Azure subscription using the following command:
trans-unit.target: Log in to your Azure subscription using the following command:

trans-unit.source: Make a note of your **TenantId** and **SubscriptionId**.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of your **TenantId** and **SubscriptionId**.

trans-unit.source: You will need them later.
trans-unit.target: You will need them later.

trans-unit.source: Create a new Azure Active Directory application using the following command, replacing the place holders:
trans-unit.target: Create a new Azure Active Directory application using the following command, replacing the place holders:

trans-unit.source: **{Display name}:** a display name for your application such as **MySampleApp**
trans-unit.target: **{Display name}:** a display name for your application such as **MySampleApp**

trans-unit.source: **{Home page URL}:** the URL of the home page of your app such as **http://mysampleapp/home**.
trans-unit.target: **{Home page URL}:** the URL of the home page of your app such as **http://mysampleapp/home**.

trans-unit.source: This URL does not need to point to a real application.
trans-unit.target: This URL does not need to point to a real application.

trans-unit.source: **{Application identifier}:** A unique identifier such as **http://mysampleapp**.
trans-unit.target: **{Application identifier}:** A unique identifier such as **http://mysampleapp**.

trans-unit.source: This URL does not need to point to a real application.
trans-unit.target: This URL does not need to point to a real application.

trans-unit.source: **{Password}:** A password that you will use to authenticate with your app.
trans-unit.target: **{Password}:** A password that you will use to authenticate with your app.

trans-unit.source: Make a note of the **ApplicationId** of the application you created.
trans-unit.target: Make a note of the **ApplicationId** of the application you created.

trans-unit.source: You will need this later.
trans-unit.target: You will need this later.

trans-unit.source: Create a new service principal using the following command, replacing **{MyApplicationId}** with the **ApplicationId** from the previous step:
trans-unit.target: Create a new service principal using the following command, replacing **{MyApplicationId}** with the **ApplicationId** from the previous step:

trans-unit.source: Setup a role assignment using the following command, replacing **{MyApplicationId}** with your **ApplicationId**.
trans-unit.target: Setup a role assignment using the following command, replacing **{MyApplicationId}** with your **ApplicationId**.

trans-unit.source: You have now finished creating the Azure AD application that will enable you to authenticate from your custom C# application.
trans-unit.target: You have now finished creating the Azure AD application that will enable you to authenticate from your custom C# application.

trans-unit.source: You will need the following values later in this tutorial:
trans-unit.target: You will need the following values later in this tutorial:

trans-unit.source: TenantId
trans-unit.target: TenantId

trans-unit.source: SubscriptionId
trans-unit.target: SubscriptionId

trans-unit.source: ApplicationId
trans-unit.target: ApplicationId

trans-unit.source: Password
trans-unit.target: Password
